item.title: iPhone 16, Apple Intelligence and more: Everything revealed at Apple Event 2024
item.dc:creator: Morgan Little
item.description:
Apple’s biggest event of the year has arrived, and with it, the iPhone 16 lineup and a slew of AI-related updates for iOS 18. Apple Intelligence is expected to be the star of the Apple event this year, like it was at WWDC in June, despite the many anticipated hardware reveals like new Apple Watches, […]

item.title: Apple Watch Series 10 debuts with bigger screen, thinner display and sleep apnea detection
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Apple Watch Series 10 debuted at Monday’s “It’s Glowtime”event, just under a decade after the iPhone maker released its first smartwatch. Headlining the new wearable is a redesign — arguably the largest since the device’s launch. The Apple Watch Series 10 has “our biggest screen and thinnest design,” CEO Tim Cook noted. The company says […]

item.title: U.S., China and other nations convene in Seoul for summit on AI use in military
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
More than 90 nations, including the U.S. and China, will convene at a two-day summit in Seoul starting Monday to attempt to establish a blueprint for the use of AI in the military. As Reuters reports, participants hope to establish minimum guardrails and suggest principles for “responsible” AI deployment aligned with NATO principles. The summit […]

item.title: Alpha Partners raises $153M third fund for pro-rata investments
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description:
Steve Brotman started Alpha Partners in 2014 with a novel idea at the time: investing alongside early-stage VCs to help preserve their ownership in promising companies as they transition to later funding rounds. Alpha’s first fund was a mere $10 million. But as startups started staying private for longer, the VC industry invented various mechanisms […]

item.title: TechCrunch Minute: Another blow to the Internet Archive’s lending library
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
The Internet Archive’s online lending library recently suffered a big defeat in court. The organization is best known for operating the Wayback Machine, which stores old versions of web pages, a task that’s felt increasingly important as more of the web disappears. But the Archive also operated a digital lending library, called the Open Library, […]

item.description:
Apple's Glowtime iPhone event will include the iPhone 16, but may also feature new AirPods, a new Apple Watch and possibly even new Macs.

item.title: Progress acquires file management platform ShareFile for $875M
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
Automation and IT monitoring company Progress on Monday announced that it intends to acquire file management platform ShareFile for $875 million in cash and credit. Progress CEO Yogesh Gupta said that the deal, which is expected to close by November 30, will bolster Progress’ portfolio with tools to help businesses more efficiently share — and […]

item.description:
Apple is likely to unveil its iPhone 16 series of phones and maybe even some Apple Watches at its Glowtime event on September 9.

item.title: Bug lets anyone bypass WhatsApp’s ‘View Once’ privacy feature
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
A flaw in the design of WhatsApp's "View Once" privacy feature let's anyone save pictures and videos that should be ephemeral.

item.title: YC alum Odigos aims to help enterprises find errors and stamp out latency in their systems
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description:
Companies’ data architecture today looks nothing like it did 20 years ago, but monitoring and tracing tools haven’t followed suit, making it difficult for engineering teams to identify the root cause of errors and latency issues.  Israeli developer Eden Federman (pictured above, right) thinks the solution is distributed tracing, a more advanced observability method, but […]

item.title: Miami-based AI bookkeeping startup Finally has raised another big round: $200M in equity and debt
item.dc:creator: Mary Ann Azevedo
item.description:
The SMB-focused bookkeeping, accounting and finance startup Finally has raised $50 million in a Series B round of funding and secured a $150 million credit line, TechCrunch is the first to report. The financing comes just seven months after the fintech company announced it had raised $10 million in funding, and brings Miami-based Finally’s total […]

item.title: Thousands of Avis car rental customers had personal data stolen in cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description:
The car rental giant says personal information, credit card information, and driver's license numbers were stolen in the August cyberattack.

item.title: Sonos delays set-top box after flawed app update

item.description:
It’s been an infamous year for software updates gone wrong. But what’s the worst-case scenario for a buggy update? Sonos may be trying to find the answer as its mobile app update continues to derail its best laid plans. In its most recent earnings call, the company announced that it had no choice but to […]

Indian electric scooter manufacturer Ather Energy plans to raise about $370 million in an IPO.

item.title: Electro-hydraulic muscles help these robot legs stand straight on uneven terrain
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
Along with the ability to automatically adjust to the surface they’re traversing, the legs move faster and jump higher than their more standardized electric counterparts.

item.title: European VC Atomico closes $1.24B across two funds for early and growth-stage startups
item.dc:creator: Paul Sawers
item.description:
Atomico has historically leaned toward earlier funding rounds while dipping into later stages where it made sense; now it's setting itself up to focus just as much on the later stages of a startup's journey.

item.title: The Try Guys say their subscription strategy is working
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
YouTube creators The Try Guys claim they’re on-track to reach profitability, with subscriptions to their three-month-old, ad-free service 2nd Try now accounting for 20% of the company’s revenue. Those numbers mean The Try Guys, known for testing out different experiences, remain reliant on other revenue streams, including YouTube advertising. But in an interview with CNBC, […]

item.title: Apple Intelligence delays could impede iPhone 16 ‘supercycle’
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater
item.description:
When Apple unveiled its AI plans at WWDC in June, analysts suggested the feature could put the iPhone 16 on track for another “supercycle.” Like the addition of 5G before it, industry watchers believed that Apple Intelligence’s arrival might convince holdouts to bite the bullet and upgrade their device. We’ll have a much better picture […]

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla has ‘no need’ to license xAI models
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description:
Elon Musk has denied a report that one of his companies, Tesla, has discussed sharing revenue with another of his companies, xAI, so that it can use the startup’s AI models. The Wall Street Journal wrote yesterday that under a proposed agreement described to investors, Tesla would use xAI models in its driver-assistance software (known […]
